00295 
00296 void nfs_debug_buddy_info()
00297 {
00298   buddy_stats_t bstats;
00299   
00300   BuddyGetStats( &bstats ) ;
00301   printf( "------- TOTAL SPACE USED FOR DISPATCHER THREAD: %12lu (on %2u pages)\n",
00302       (unsigned long)bstats.StdUsedSpace, bstats.NbStdUsed );
00303   
00304   DisplayMemoryMap();
00305   
00306   printf( "--------------------------------------------------\n" ) ;
00307 }

00322 void nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy( struct svc_req * ptr_req , SVCXPRT * ptr_svc )  
00323 {
00324   DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCH DUMMY: Possible error, function nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy should never be called" ) ;
00325   return ;
00326 } /* nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy */
00327 
00328       
00336 int nfs_Init_svc( )
00337 {
00338   struct sockaddr_in      sinaddr_nfs;
00339   struct sockaddr_in      sinaddr_mnt;
00340   int                     addr_size;
00341   int                     one = 1 ;
00342   int                     rc = 0 ;
00343   int                     nb_svc_nfs_ok = 0 ;
00344   int                     nb_svc_mnt_ok = 0 ;
00345   OM_uint32               maj_stat ;
00346   OM_uint32               min_stat ;
00347   char                    GssError[1024] ;
00348   gss_cred_id_t           test_gss_cred = NULL ;
00349   gss_name_t              imported_name  = NULL ;
00350 
00351   FD_ZERO( &Svc_fdset ) ;
00352   
00353   /* Allocate the UDP and TCP structure for the RPC */
00354   if( ( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_udp = socket( AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_UDP ) ) < 0 )
00355     {
00356       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SOCKET, errno ) ;
00357       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot allocate a udp socket" ) ;
00358       return -1 ;
00359     }
00360   
00361   if( ( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_tcp = socket( AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, IPPROTO_TCP) ) < 0 )
00362     {
00363       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SOCKET, errno ) ;
00364       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot allocate a tcp socket" ) ;
00365       return -1 ;
00366     }
00367 
00368   if( ( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_udp = socket( AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_UDP ) ) < 0 )
00369     {
00370       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SOCKET, errno ) ;
00371       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot allocate a udp socket" ) ;
00372       return -1 ;
00373     }
00374   
00375   if( ( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_tcp = socket( AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, IPPROTO_TCP) ) < 0 )
00376     {
00377       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SOCKET, errno ) ;
00378       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot allocate a tcp socket" ) ;
00379       return -1 ;
00380     }
00381 
00382   /* Use SO_REUSEADDR in order to avoid wait the 2MSL timeout */
00383   if( setsockopt( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_udp,
00384                   SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, &one, sizeof( one ) ) )
00385     {
00386       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SETSOCKOPT, errno ) ;
00387       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Bad udp socket options" ) ;
00388       return -1 ;
00389     }
00390 
00391   if( setsockopt( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_tcp,
00392                   SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, &one, sizeof( one ) ) )
00393     {
00394       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SETSOCKOPT, errno ) ;
00395       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Bad tcp socket options" ) ;
00396       return -1 ;
00397     }
00398 
00399   socket_setoptions( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_tcp  ) ;
00400   
00401   if( setsockopt( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_udp,
00402                   SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, &one, sizeof( one ) ) )
00403     {
00404       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SETSOCKOPT, errno ) ;
00405       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Bad udp socket options" ) ;
00406       return -1 ;
00407     }
00408   
00409   if( setsockopt( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_tcp,
00410                   SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, &one, sizeof( one ) ) )
00411     {
00412       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SETSOCKOPT, errno ) ;
00413       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Bad tcp socket options" ) ;
00414       return -1 ;
00415     }
00416   
00417   /* We prefer using non-blocking socket in the specific case */
00418   if( fcntl( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_udp, F_SETFL, FNDELAY) == -1) 
00419     {
00420       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_FCNTL, errno ) ;
00421       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot set udp socket as non blocking" ) ;
00422       return -1 ;
00423     }
00424 
00425   if( fcntl( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_udp, F_SETFL, FNDELAY) == -1) 
00426     {
00427       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_FCNTL, errno ) ;
00428       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot set udp socket as non blocking" ) ;
00429       return -1 ;
00430     }
00431 
00432   /* Some log that can be useful when debug ONC/RPC and RPCSEC_GSS matter */ 
00433   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Socket numbers are: nfs_udp=%u  nfs_tcp=%u  mnt_udp=%u  mnt_tcp=%u", 
00434                    nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_udp, 
00435                    nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_tcp,
00436                    nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_udp,
00437                    nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_tcp ) ; 
00438   
00439   /* Bind the udp and tcp socket to port 2049/tcp and 2049/udp */
00440   memset((char *) &sinaddr_nfs, 0, sizeof( sinaddr_nfs ) );
00441   sinaddr_nfs.sin_family      = AF_INET ;
00442   sinaddr_nfs.sin_addr.s_addr = INADDR_ANY ; /* All the interfaces on the machine are used */
00443   sinaddr_nfs.sin_port        = htons( nfs_param.core_param.nfs_port );
00444 
00445   /* It's now time for binding the sockets */
00446   if( bind( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_udp, 
00447             (struct sockaddr *) &sinaddr_nfs, sizeof( sinaddr_nfs ) ) == -1)
00448     {
00449       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_BIND, errno ) ;
00450       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot bind udp socket" ) ;
00451       return -1 ;
00452     }
00453 
00454   if( ( rc = bind( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_tcp, 
00455                    (struct sockaddr *) &sinaddr_nfs, sizeof( sinaddr_nfs ) ) ) == -1)
00456     {
00457       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_BIND, errno ) ;
00458       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot bind tcp socket rc=%d errno=%d", rc, errno ) ;
00459       return -1 ;
00460     }
00461 
00462   /* Bind the udp and tcp socket to ephemeral port for mountd */
00463   memset((char *) &sinaddr_mnt, 0, sizeof( sinaddr_mnt ) );
00464   sinaddr_mnt.sin_family      = AF_INET ;
00465   sinaddr_mnt.sin_addr.s_addr = INADDR_ANY ; /* All the interfaces on the machine are used */
00466   sinaddr_mnt.sin_port        = htons( nfs_param.core_param.mnt_port ) ;
00467 
00468   /* It's now time for binding the sockets */
00469   if( bind( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_udp, 
00470             (struct sockaddr *) &sinaddr_mnt, sizeof( sinaddr_mnt ) ) == -1)
00471     {
00472       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_BIND, errno ) ;
00473       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot bind udp socket" ) ;
00474       return -1 ;
00475     }
00476 
00477   if( ( rc = bind( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_tcp, 
00478                    (struct sockaddr *) &sinaddr_mnt, sizeof( sinaddr_mnt ) ) ) == -1)
00479     {
00480       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_BIND, errno ) ;
00481       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot bind tcp socket rc=%d errno=%d", rc, errno ) ;
00482       return -1 ;
00483     }
00484 
00485   
00486   /* Unset the port mapper */
00487   pmap_unset( nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program, NFS_V2 );
00488   pmap_unset( nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program, NFS_V3 );
00489   pmap_unset( nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program, NFS_V4 );
00490   pmap_unset( nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program, MOUNT_V1 );
00491   pmap_unset( nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program, MOUNT_V3 );
00492 
00493   /* Allocation of the SVCXPRT */
00494   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Allocation of the SVCXPRT" ) ;
00495 
00496   if( ( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_udp = 
00497         Svcudp_bufcreate( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_udp,
00498                           NFS_SEND_BUFFER_SIZE, 
00499                           NFS_RECV_BUFFER_SIZE ) ) == NULL )
00500     {
00501       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVCUDP_CREATE, 0 ) ;
00502       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot allocate NFS/UDP SVCXPRT" ) ;
00503       return -1  ;
00504     }
00505 
00506   if( ( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_tcp =
00507         Svctcp_create( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_tcp, 
00508                        NFS_SEND_BUFFER_SIZE, 
00509                        NFS_RECV_BUFFER_SIZE ) ) == NULL )
00510     {
00511       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVCTCP_CREATE, 0 ) ;
00512       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot allocate NFS/TCP SVCXPRT" ) ;
00513       return -1  ;
00514     }  
00515 
00516   if( ( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_udp = 
00517         Svcudp_bufcreate( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_udp,
00518                           NFS_SEND_BUFFER_SIZE, 
00519                           NFS_RECV_BUFFER_SIZE ) ) == NULL )
00520     {
00521       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVCUDP_CREATE, 0 ) ;
00522       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot allocate MNT/UDP SVCXPRT" ) ;
00523       return -1  ;
00524     }
00525 
00526   if( ( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_tcp =
00527         Svctcp_create( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_tcp, 
00528                        NFS_SEND_BUFFER_SIZE, 
00529                        NFS_RECV_BUFFER_SIZE ) ) == NULL )
00530     {
00531       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVCTCP_CREATE, 0 ) ;
00532       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot allocate MNT/TCP SVCXPRT" ) ;
00533       return -1  ;
00534     }  
00535 
00536 #ifdef _USE_GSSRPC
00537   /* Acquire RPCSEC_GSS basis if needed */
00538   if( rpcsec_gss_flag == TRUE )
00539     {
00540      if( Svcauth_gss_import_name( nfs_param.krb5_param.principal ) != TRUE )
00541        {
00542          DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Could not import principal name %s into GSSAPI", nfs_param.krb5_param.principal ) ;
00543          exit( 1 ) ;
00544        }
00545      else
00546        {
00547          DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Successfully imported principal %s into GSSAPI", nfs_param.krb5_param.principal ) ;
00548 
00549         
00550         /* Trying to acquire a credentials for checking name's validity */
00551         if( !Svcauth_gss_acquire_cred() )
00552            {
00553                DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot acquire credentials for principal %s", nfs_param.krb5_param.principal ) ;
00554                exit( 1 ) ;
00555            }
00556          else
00557            {
00558                 DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Principal %s is suitable for acquiring credentials", nfs_param.krb5_param.principal ) ;    
00559            }
00560        }
00561     } /* if( rpcsec_gss_flag == TRUE ) */
00562 #endif
00563 
00564   /* Perform all the RPC registration, for UDP and TCP, for NFS_V2, NFS_V3 and NFS_V4 */
00565   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registration to the portmapper for NFS and MOUNT, on UDP and TCP" ) ;
00566 
00567 #ifndef _USE_PROXY /* only NFSv4 is supported for the FSAL_PROXY */
00568   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering NFS V2/UDP" ) ;
00569   if( !Svc_register( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_udp, 
00570                      nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
00571                      NFS_V2, 
00572                      nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00573                      IPPROTO_UDP ) )
00574     {
00575       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
00576       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register NFS V2 on UDP" ) ;
00577     }
00578   else
00579       nb_svc_nfs_ok += 1 ;
00580   
00581   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering NFS V3/UDP" ) ;
00582   if( !Svc_register( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_udp,
00583                      nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
00584                      NFS_V3, 
00585                      nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00586                      IPPROTO_UDP ) ) 
00587     {
00588       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
00589       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register NFS V3 on UDP" ) ;
00590     }
00591   else
00592       nb_svc_nfs_ok += 1 ;
00593 #endif /* _USE_PROXY */
00594   
00595   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering NFS V4/UDP" ) ;
00596   if( !Svc_register( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_udp, 
00597                      nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
00598                      NFS_V4, 
00599                      nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00600                      IPPROTO_UDP ) ) 
00601     {
00602       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
00603       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register NFS V4 on UDP" ) ;
00604     }
00605   else
00606     {
00607       nb_svc_nfs_ok += 1 ;
00608 #ifdef _USE_PROXY
00609       nb_svc_mnt_ok += 1 ;
00610 #endif
00611     }
00612   
00613 #ifndef _NO_TCP_REGISTER
00614   
00615 #ifndef _USE_PROXY /* only NFSv4 is supported for the FSAL_PROXY */
00616   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering NFS V2/TCP" ) ;
00617   if( !Svc_register( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_tcp, 
00618                      nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
00619                      NFS_V2, 
00620                      nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00621                      IPPROTO_TCP ) ) 
00622     {
00623       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
00624       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register NFS V2 on TCP" ) ;
00625     }
00626   else
00627       nb_svc_nfs_ok += 1 ;
00628 
00629   
00630   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering NFS V3/TCP" ) ;
00631   if( !Svc_register( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_tcp, 
00632                      nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
00633                      NFS_V3, 
00634                      nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00635                      IPPROTO_TCP ) ) 
00636     {
00637       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
00638       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register NFS V3 on TCP" ) ;
00639     }
00640   else
00641       nb_svc_nfs_ok += 1 ;
00642 #endif /* _USE_PROXY */
00643   
00644   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering NFS V4/TCP" ) ;
00645   if( !Svc_register( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_tcp, 
00646                      nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
00647                      NFS_V4, 
00648                      nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00649                      IPPROTO_TCP ) ) 
00650     {
00651       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
00652       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register NFS V4 on TCP" ) ;
00653     }
00654   else
00655     {
00656       nb_svc_nfs_ok += 1 ;
00657 #ifdef _USE_PROXY
00658       nb_svc_mnt_ok = 1 ;
00659 #endif
00660     }
00661 #endif
00662    
00663 #ifndef _USE_PROXY 
00664   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering MOUNT V1/UDP" ) ;
00665   if( !Svc_register( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_udp, 
00666                      nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program,
00667                      MOUNT_V1,
00668                      nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00669                      IPPROTO_UDP ) ) 
00670     {
00671       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
00672       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register MOUNT V1 on UDP" ) ;
00673     }
00674   else
00675       nb_svc_mnt_ok += 1 ;
00676 
00677   
00678   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering MOUNT V3/UDP" ) ;
00679   if( !Svc_register( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_udp, 
00680                      nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program,
00681                      MOUNT_V3,
00682                      nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00683                      IPPROTO_UDP ) ) 
00684     {
00685       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
00686       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register MOUNT V3 on UDP" ) ;
00687     }
00688   else
00689       nb_svc_mnt_ok += 1 ;
00690 #endif /* _USE_PROXY */
00691 
00692 #ifndef _NO_TCP_REGISTER  
00693  
00694 #ifndef _USE_PROXY  
00695   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering MOUNT V1/TCP" ) ;
00696   if( !Svc_register( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_tcp, 
00697                      nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program,
00698                      MOUNT_V1,
00699                      nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00700                      IPPROTO_TCP ) ) 
00701     {
00702       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
00703       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register MOUNT V1 on TCP" ) ;
00704     }
00705   else
00706       nb_svc_mnt_ok += 1 ;
00707 
00708   
00709   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering MOUNT V3/TCP" ) ;
00710   if( !Svc_register( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_tcp, 
00711                      nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program,
00712                      MOUNT_V3,
00713                      nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00714                      IPPROTO_TCP ) ) 
00715     {
00716       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
00717       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register MOUNT V3 on TCP" ) ;
00718     }
00719   else
00720       nb_svc_mnt_ok += 1 ;
00721 #else
00722       nb_svc_mnt_ok += 1 ;
00723 #endif /* _USE_PROXY */
00724 
00725 #endif /* _NO_TCP_REGISTER */
00726   
00727   /* Were at least one NFS/MNT registration ok ? */
00728   if( nb_svc_nfs_ok == 0 ||nb_svc_mnt_ok == 0 )
00729      {
00730         /* Not enough registration for servicing clients */
00731         DisplayLog( "NFS_DISPATCHER: /!\\ | No registration to NFS and/or MOUNT programs were done..." ) ;
00732         return 1 ;
00733      }
00734  
00735   return 0 ;
00736 } /* nfs_Init_svc */
00737 
00738 
00743 static unsigned int select_worker_queue( )
00744 {
00745 #define NO_VALUE_CHOOSEN  1000000
00746   unsigned int worker_index = NO_VALUE_CHOOSEN;
00747   unsigned int min_number_pending = NO_VALUE_CHOOSEN ;
00748   
00749   unsigned int i;
00750   static unsigned int last ;
00751   unsigned int cpt = 0 ;
00752  
00753   do {
00754   
00755     /* chose the smallest queue */
00756     
00757     for( i = (last +1)% nfs_param.core_param.nb_worker , cpt = 0 ; cpt <  nfs_param.core_param.nb_worker ; cpt ++ , i = ( i + 1 ) %  nfs_param.core_param.nb_worker ) 
00758     {
00759         /* Choose only fully initialized workers and that does not gc */
00760       
00761         if ( ( workers_data[i].gc_in_progress == FALSE )
00762                    && ( workers_data[i].is_ready == TRUE ) )
00763         {
00764           if ( workers_data[i].pending_request->nb_entry < min_number_pending )
00765           {
00766             worker_index = i;
00767             min_number_pending = workers_data[i].pending_request->nb_entry;
00768           }
00769         }
00770   #     ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00771         else if ( ! workers_data[i].is_ready )
00772           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "worker thread #%u is not ready", i ) ;
00773         else if ( workers_data[i].gc_in_progress )
00774           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "worker thread #%u is doing garbage collection", i ) ;
00775   #     endif
00776 
00777     }
00778     
00779   } while( worker_index == NO_VALUE_CHOOSEN );  
00780    
00781   last = worker_index ;
00782 
00783   return worker_index;
00784   
00785 } /* select_worker_queue */
00786 
00796 int nfs_rpc_get_worker_index( int mount_protocol_flag )
00797 {
00798   int worker_index = -1 ;
00799 
00800 #ifndef _NO_MOUNT_LIST
00801   if( mount_protocol_flag == TRUE )
00802       worker_index = 0 ; /* worker #0 is dedicated to mount protocol */
00803   else
00804     worker_index = select_worker_queue(  ) ;
00805 #else
00806   /* choose a worker depending on its queue length */
00807   worker_index = select_worker_queue() ;
00808 #endif
00809 
00810   return worker_index ;
00811 } /* nfs_rpc_get_worker_index */
00812 
00813 
00826 void nfs_rpc_getreq( fd_set * readfds, nfs_parameter_t * pnfs_para )
00827 {
00828   enum xprt_stat stat;
00829   struct rpc_msg * pmsg;
00830   u_long low_vers;
00831   u_long high_vers;
00832   struct svc_req * preq;
00833   register SVCXPRT *xprt;
00834   register int bit;
00835   register long  mask, *maskp;
00836   register int sock;
00837   char * cred_area ;
00838 
00839   LRU_entry_t * pentry = NULL ;
00840   LRU_status_t  status ;
00841   nfs_request_data_t * pnfsreq = NULL ;
00842   int worker_index ;
00843   int mount_flag = FALSE  ;
00844 
00845   /* portable access to fds_bits field */
00846   maskp = __FDS_BITS( readfds ) ;
00847       
00848   for (sock = 0; sock < FD_SETSIZE; sock += NFDBITS)
00849     {
00850       for (mask = *maskp++; bit = ffs(mask); mask ^= (1 << (bit - 1))) 
00851         {
00852           /* sock has input waiting */
00853           xprt = Xports[sock + bit - 1];
00854           if (xprt == NULL)
00855             {
00856               /* But do we control sock? */
00857               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_CRIT, "CRITICAL ERROR: Incoherency found in Xports array" ) ;
00858               continue;
00859             }
00860 
00861           /* A few thread manage only mount protocol, check for this */
00862           if(  ( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_udp ==  sock + bit - 1  ) ||
00863                ( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_tcp ==  sock + bit - 1  ) )     
00864                 mount_flag = TRUE ;
00865           else
00866                 mount_flag = FALSE ;
00867          
00868           /* Get a worker to do the job */
00869           if( ( worker_index = nfs_rpc_get_worker_index( mount_flag ) ) < 0 )
00870            {
00871              DisplayLog( "CRITICAL ERROR: Couldn't choose a worker ! Exiting..." ) ;
00872              exit( 1 ) ;
00873            }
00874 
00875 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00876           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Use request from spool #%d, xprt->xp_sock=%d",
00877                            worker_index, xprt->xp_sock ) ;
00878 #endif
00879 
00880           /* Get a pnfsreq from the worker's pool */
00881           P( workers_data[worker_index].request_pool_mutex ) ;
00882 
00883 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
00884           /* For debugging memory leaks */
00885           BuddySetDebugLabel( "nfs_request_data_t" ) ;
00886 #endif
00887 
00888           GET_PREALLOC_CONSTRUCT( pnfsreq,
00889                                   workers_data[worker_index].request_pool,
00890                                   nfs_param.worker_param.nb_pending_prealloc,
00891                                   nfs_request_data_t,
00892                                   next_alloc,
00893                                   constructor_nfs_request_data_t ) ;
00894 
00895 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
00896           /* For debugging memory leaks */
00897           BuddySetDebugLabel( "N/A" ) ;
00898 #endif
00899           V( workers_data[worker_index].request_pool_mutex ) ;
00900 
00901           if( pnfsreq == NULL )
00902            {
00903              DisplayLogLevel( NIV_CRIT, "CRITICAL ERROR: empty request pool for the chosen worker ! Exiting..." ) ;
00904              exit( 0 ) ;
00905            }
00906 
00907 
00908           /* Set up pointers */
00909           cred_area = pnfsreq->cred_area ;
00910           preq = &(pnfsreq->req) ;
00911           pmsg = &(pnfsreq->msg) ;
00912 
00913           pmsg->rm_call.cb_cred.oa_base = cred_area ;
00914           pmsg->rm_call.cb_verf.oa_base = &(cred_area[MAX_AUTH_BYTES]);
00915           preq->rq_clntcred = &(cred_area[2 * MAX_AUTH_BYTES]);
00916 
00917           
00918           /*
00919            * UDP RPCs are quite simple: everything comes to the same socket, so several SVCXPRT
00920            * can be defined, one per tbuf to handle the stuff
00921            * TCP RPCs are more complex:
00922            *   - a unique SVCXPRT exists that deals with initial tcp rendez vous. It does the accept
00923            *     with the client, but recv no message from the client. But SVC_RECV on it creates
00924            *     a new SVCXPRT dedicated to the client. This specific SVXPRT is bound on TCPSocket
00925            *
00926            * while receiving something on the Svc_fdset, I must know if this is a UDP request,
00927            * an initial TCP request or a TCP socket from an already connected client.
00928            * This is how to distinguish the cases:
00929            * UDP connections are bound to socket NFS_UDPSocket
00930            * TCP initial connections are bound to socket NFS_TCPSocket
00931            * all the other cases are requests from already connected TCP Clients
00932            */
00933 
00934           if( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_udp == sock + bit - 1  )
00935             {
00936               /* This is a regular UDP connection */
00937 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00938               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "A NFS UDP request" ) ;
00939 #endif
00940               pnfsreq->xprt = pnfsreq->udp_xprt ;
00941               pnfsreq->ipproto = IPPROTO_UDP ;
00942 
00943               pnfsreq->status = SVC_RECV( pnfsreq->xprt, &(pnfsreq->msg) ) ;
00944             }
00945           else if( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_udp ==  sock + bit - 1  )
00946             {
00947 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00948               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "A MOUNT UDP request" ) ;
00949 #endif
00950               pnfsreq->xprt = nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_udp ;
00951               pnfsreq->ipproto = IPPROTO_UDP ;
00952               
00953               pnfsreq->status = SVC_RECV( pnfsreq->xprt, &(pnfsreq->msg) ) ;
00954             } 
00955           else if( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_tcp == sock + bit -1 )
00956             {
00957               /* 
00958                * This is an initial tcp connection 
00959                * There is no RPC message, this is only a TCP connect.
00960                * In this case, the SVC_RECV does only produces a new connected socket (it does
00961                * just a call to accept and FD_SET)
00962                * there is no need of worker thread processing to be done
00963                */
00964 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00965               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "An initial NFS TCP request from a new client" ) ;
00966 #endif
00967               pnfsreq->xprt = nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_tcp ;
00968               pnfsreq->ipproto = IPPROTO_TCP ;
00969 
00970               pnfsreq->status = SVC_RECV( pnfsreq->xprt, &(pnfsreq->msg) );
00971             }
00972           else if( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_tcp == sock + bit -1 )
00973             {
00974 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00975               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "An initial MOUNT TCP request from a new client" ) ;
00976 #endif
00977               pnfsreq->xprt = nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_tcp ;
00978               pnfsreq->ipproto = IPPROTO_TCP ;
00979 
00980               pnfsreq->status = SVC_RECV( pnfsreq->xprt, &(pnfsreq->msg) );
00981             }
00982           else
00983             {
00984               /* This is a regular tcp request on an established connection, should be handle by a dedicated thread */
00985 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00986               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "A NFS TCP request from an already connected client" ) ;
00987 #endif
00988               pnfsreq->tcp_xprt = xprt ;
00989               pnfsreq->xprt = pnfsreq->tcp_xprt  ;
00990               pnfsreq->ipproto = IPPROTO_TCP ;
00991 
00992               pnfsreq->status = SVC_RECV( pnfsreq->xprt, &(pnfsreq->msg) ) ;
00993             }
00994 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00995           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Status for SVC_RECV on socket %d is %d", sock + bit -1, pnfsreq->status ) ;
00996 #endif
00997           
00998           /* If status is ok, the request will be processed by the related
00999            * worker, otherwise, it should be released by being tagged as invalid*/
01000           if( !pnfsreq->status  )
01001             {
01002               /* RPC over TCP specific: RPC/UDP's xprt know only one state: XPRT_IDLE, because UDP is mostly
01003                * a stateless protocol. With RPC/TCP, they can be XPRT_DIED especially when the client closes
01004                * the peer's socket. We have to cope with this aspect in the next lines */
01005              
01006               stat = SVC_STAT( pnfsreq->xprt ) ;
01007               if( stat == XPRT_DIED )
01008                 {
01009                   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "A client disappeared... socket=%d",  pnfsreq->xprt->xp_sock ) ;
01010 
01011                   if( Xports[ pnfsreq->xprt->xp_sock ] != NULL ) 
01012                     SVC_DESTROY( Xports[ pnfsreq->xprt->xp_sock ] ) ;
01013 
01014                   RELEASE_PREALLOC( pnfsreq,  workers_data[worker_index].request_pool, next_alloc ) ; 
01015 
01016                 }
01017              else if(  stat == XPRT_MOREREQS )
01018                {
01019                  DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "Client on socket %d has status XPRT_MOREREQS", pnfsreq->xprt->xp_sock ) ;
01020                }
01021  
01022               /* Release the entry */
01023 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
01024               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS DISPATCH: Invalidating entry with xprt_stat=%d", stat ) ;
01025 #endif         
01026               workers_data[worker_index].passcounter += 1 ;
01027             }
01028           else
01029             {
01030               /* This should be used for UDP requests only, TCP request have dedicted management threads */
01031 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH           
01032               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Awaking thread #%d",worker_index ) ;
01033 #endif
01034 
01035               P( workers_data[worker_index].mutex_req_condvar ) ;
01036               P( workers_data[worker_index].request_pool_mutex ) ;
01037 
01038               if( ( pentry = LRU_new_entry( workers_data[worker_index].pending_request, &status ) ) == NULL )
01039                {
01040                  V( workers_data[worker_index].mutex_req_condvar ) ;
01041                  V( workers_data[worker_index].request_pool_mutex ) ;
01042                  DisplayLogLevel( NIV_MAJOR, "Error while inserting pending request to Thread #%d... exiting", worker_index ) ;
01043                  exit( 1 ) ;
01044                }
01045               pentry->buffdata.pdata = (caddr_t)pnfsreq ;
01046               pentry->buffdata.len = sizeof( *pnfsreq ) ;
01047 
01048               if( pthread_cond_signal( &(workers_data[worker_index].req_condvar) ) == -1 )
01049                 {
01050                   V( workers_data[worker_index].mutex_req_condvar ) ;
01051                   V( workers_data[worker_index].request_pool_mutex ) ;
01052                   DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCH: Cond signal failed for thr#%d , errno = %d", worker_index, errno ) ;
01053                   exit( 1 ) ;
01054                 }
01055                V( workers_data[worker_index].mutex_req_condvar ) ;
01056                V( workers_data[worker_index].request_pool_mutex ) ;
01057             }
01058         }
01059     }
01060 } /* nfs_rpc_getreq */
01061 
01074 int clean_pending_request( LRU_entry_t * pentry, void * addparam )
01075 {
01076   nfs_request_data_t ** preqnfspool = (nfs_request_data_t **)addparam ;
01077   nfs_request_data_t *  preqnfs     = (nfs_request_data_t *)(pentry->buffdata.pdata) ;
01078 
01079   /* Send the entry back to the pool */
01080   RELEASE_PREALLOC( preqnfs, *preqnfspool, next_alloc ) ;
01081 
01082   return 0 ;
01083 } /* clean_pending_request */
01084 
01097 int print_pending_request( LRU_data_t data, char *str )
01098 {
01099   return snprintf( str, LRU_DISPLAY_STRLEN, "not implemented for now" ) ;
01100 } /* print_pending_request */
01101 
01113 void rpc_dispatcher_svc_run( nfs_parameter_t * pnfs_param )
01114 {
01115   fd_set readfdset;
01116   static int tablesize ;
01117   int rc = 0 ;
01118   
01119 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS   
01120   static int nb_iter_memleaks = 0 ;
01121 #endif
01122   
01123   tablesize = getdtablesize();
01124 
01125   while( TRUE )
01126     {
01127       /* Always work on a copy of Svc_fdset */
01128       readfdset = Svc_fdset;
01129 
01130       /* Select on a fdset build with all socket used in NFS/RPC */
01131 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
01132       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "Waiting for incoming RPC requests" ) ;
01133 #endif
01134       
01135       /* Do the select on the RPC fdset */
01136       rc = select( tablesize, &readfdset, NULL, NULL, NULL) ;
01137 
01138 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
01139       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "Waiting for incoming RPC requests, after select rc=%d", rc ) ;
01140 #endif
01141       switch( rc ) 
01142         {
01143         case -1:
01144           if( errno == EBADF )
01145             {
01146               DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SELECT, errno ) ;
01147               return;
01148             }
01149           break ;
01150          
01151         case 0:
01152           continue; 
01153 
01154         default:
01155 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
01156           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS SVC RUN: request(s) received" ) ;
01157 #endif
01158           nfs_rpc_getreq(&readfdset, pnfs_param );
01159           break ;
01160          
01161         } /* switch */
01162         
01163         
01164 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
01165     if( nb_iter_memleaks > 1000 )
01166       {
01167         nb_iter_memleaks = 0  ;
01168         nfs_debug_buddy_info() ;
01169       }
01170     else
01171       nb_iter_memleaks += 1 ;
01172 #endif
01173 
01174     } /* while */
01175 
01176   return ;
01177 } /* rpc_dispatcher_svc_run */
01178 
01190 void * rpc_dispatcher_thread( void * Arg )
01191 {
01192   int               rc         = 0 ;
01193   nfs_parameter_t * pnfs_param = (nfs_parameter_t *)Arg ;
01194 
01195   SetNameFunction( "dispatch_thr" ) ;
01196   
01197 #ifndef _NO_BUDDY_SYSTEM
01198   /* Initialisation of the Buddy Malloc */ 
01199   DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Initialization of memory manager" ) ;
01200   if ( ( rc = BuddyInit( &nfs_param.buddy_param_worker )) != BUDDY_SUCCESS )
01201     {
01202       /* Failed init */
01203       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Memory manager could not be initialized, exiting..." ) ;
01204       exit( 1 ) ;
01205     }
01206 #endif
01207   /* Calling dispatcher main loop */
01208   DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Entering nfs/rpc dispatcher" ) ;
01209 
01210   DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: my pthread id is %p", (caddr_t)pthread_self() ) ;
01211 
01212   rpc_dispatcher_svc_run( pnfs_param ) ;
01213   
01214   return NULL ;
01215 } /* rpc_dispatcher_thread */
01216 
01217 
01231 int nfs_Init_request_data(  nfs_request_data_t * pdata ) 
01232 {
01233   pdata->ipproto = 0 ;
01234   
01235   /* Init the SVCXPRT for the tcp socket */
01236   /* The choice of the fd to be used here doesn't really matter, this fd will be overwrittem later 
01237    * when processing the request */
01238   pdata->tcp_xprt = NULL ;
01239   
01240   if( ( pdata->udp_xprt = Svcudp_bufcreate( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_udp,
01241                                             NFS_SEND_BUFFER_SIZE, NFS_RECV_BUFFER_SIZE) ) == NULL )
01242     {
01243       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVCUDP_CREATE, 0 );
01244       return -1 ;
01245     }
01246 
01247   pdata->xprt = NULL ;
01248   
01249   return 0 ;
01250 } /* nfs_Init_request_data */ 
01251 
01252 
01265 void constructor_nfs_request_data_t( void * ptr ) 
01266 {
01267    nfs_request_data_t * pdata = (nfs_request_data_t *)ptr ;
01268 
01269   if( nfs_Init_request_data( ptr ) != 0 )
01270      {
01271         DisplayLog( "NFS INIT: Error while initing request data " ) ;
01272         exit( 1 ) ;
01273      }
01274 }
01275 
01288 int nfs_Init_gc_counter( void )
01289 {
01290   pthread_mutexattr_t mutexattr ;
01291 
01292   if( pthread_mutexattr_init( &mutexattr ) != 0 )
01293     return -1 ;
01294 
01295   if( pthread_mutex_init( &lock_nb_current_gc_workers, &mutexattr ) !=0 )
01296     return -1 ;
01297 
01298   nb_current_gc_workers = 0 ;
01299   
01300   return 0 ; /* Success */
01301 } /* nfs_Init_gc_counter */
